posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I thought I'd post a build I've been working on for a little while. The idea is actually kind of funny. The good guy arrives in Heaven and someone asks him: "How did you die?". The guy responds: "Well, I was walking around the road when a HUGE DRAGON came out of nowhere and caught me off-guard!". How can you not see a dragon approaching, right? Well, here is how:

Surprise!

Druid(24), Assassin(14), Shadowdancer(2), Human

Alignment: Neutral Evil

Playability: 1-40 PvM

STR: 8
DEX: 15 (16)
CON: 8
WIS: 18 (34)
INT: 14
CHA: 8

Human: (Quick to Master)
01: Druid(1): Knockdown, Extend Spell
02: Druid(2)
03: Druid(3): Blind Fight
04: Druid(4): WIS+1, (WIS=19)
05: Druid(5)
06: Druid(6): Zen Archery
07: Druid(7)
08: Druid(8): WIS+1, (WIS=20)
09: Druid(9): Empower Spell
10: Druid(10)
11: Druid(11)
12: Druid(12): WIS+1, Improved Critical: Unarmed, (WIS=21)
13: Druid(13)
14: Druid(14)
15: Druid(15): Dodge
16: Druid(16): WIS+1, (WIS=22)
17: Assassin(1)
18: Assassin(2): Mobility, {Uncanny Dodge I}
19: Assassin(3)
20: Assassin(4): WIS+1, (WIS=23)
21: Druid(17): Great Wisdom I, (WIS=24)
22: Shadowdancer(1): {Hide in Plain Sight}
23: Shadowdancer(2): {Darkvision, Evasion}
24: Assassin(5): WIS+1, Great Wisdom II, (WIS=26)
25: Assassin(6)
26: Assassin(7)
27: Assassin(8): Great Wisdom III, (WIS=27)
28: Assassin(9): WIS+1, (WIS=28)
29: Assassin(10)
30: Assassin(11): Great Wisdom IV, (WIS=29)
31: Assassin(12)
32: Assassin(13): WIS+1, (WIS=30)
33: Druid(18): Dragon Shape
34: Druid(19)
35: Druid(20) 36: Druid(21): WIS+1, Epic Prowess, (WIS=31)
37: Druid(22) 38: Druid(23)
39: Druid(24): Great Wisdom V, Great Wisdom VI, (WIS=33)
40: Assassin(14): WIS+1, Great Dexterity I, (DEX=16), (WIS=34)

Hitpoints: 252
Skillpoints: 305
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 20/33/22
Saving Throw bonuses: Traps: +2, Poison: +6, Fear: +2
BAB: 25
AB (max, naked): 25 (melee), 38 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 21/28
Spell Casting: Druid(9)
Alignment Changes: 0

Animal Empathy 21(20), Concentration 42(41), Heal 21(33), Hide 43(46), Move Silently 43(46), Spot 43(55), Tumble 40(43), UMD 36(35)

01: Animal Empathy(4), Concentration(4), Hide(2), Move Silently(2), Save(12),
02: Animal Empathy(1), Concentration(1), Save(17),
03: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(19),
04: Animal Empathy(1), Save(25),
05: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(27),
06: Animal Empathy(1), Save(33),
07: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(35),
08: Animal Empathy(1), Save(41),
09: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(43),
10: Animal Empathy(1), Save(49),
11: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(51),
12: Animal Empathy(1), Save(57),
13: Animal Empathy(1), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Save(59),
14: Animal Empathy(1), Save(65),

18: Heal(2), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1),
19: Heal(2), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1),
20: Heal(2), Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1),
21: Animal Empathy(2), Heal(1), Save(4),
22: Hide(2), Move Silently(2), Spot(2), Tumble(2), Save(5),
23: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), Save(10),
24: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(4), Save(9),
25: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(11),
26: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(13),
27: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(15),
28: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(17),
29: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(19),
30: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(21),
31: Hide(1), Move Silently(1), Spot(1), Tumble(1), UMD(1), Save(23),
32: Save(30),
33: Concentration(31), Heal(6),
34: Concentration(1), Heal(6),
35: Concentration(1), Heal(2), Save(4),
36: Concentration(1), Save(10),
37: Concentration(1), Save(16),
38: Concentration(1), Save(22),
39: Concentration(1), Save(28),
40: Hide(9), Move Silently(9), Spot(9), Tumble(6), UMD(2),

Well, I thought I'd steer out of the whole Druid / Monk thing and try something that literally has NEVER been done before. This is by no means a Powerbuild, but it's fun to play, even though kind of hard to RP. It will only have 3 Attacks per Round, but with the Dragon's huge STR and the 7d6 Sneak Attack, a small chance of paralyzing opponents (that will get doubled with a Haste Helm or Armor), and pretty good AB (57 with all buffs on and Capped STR). HiPS will make you nearly immortal, allow you to rebuff, heal and reposition even before you get your Dragon Shape. You can scout all your enemies, strategize and flee if things get nasty. Of course, you don't have HiPS till level 22, but you have all Druid buffs, summoning spells, elemental shape, etc.. to get through them.

No similar builds in the Search Engine. So, how do you like the idea?

Take it EZ!

EDIT I: Valerfor suggested an interesting tweak to the build below. You can change the spread to 20 / 18 / 2 and take ESF: Hide and ESF: Move Silently with Assassin Bonus Feats, making him even harder to detect. However, that would make you dispellable, and you'd end up on lower Wisdom, which means lower DCs for your spells, a few less spells per day and lower durations with the -4 Caster Levels. The gain is +1 AC from Armor Skin (you lose 1 AC from the Great Dexterity feat and end up in an odd score, might as well drop it for CON and more HP in Human form). Anyway, it's a viable tweak that is absolutely in line with the theme and would make him better at that which he's already really good, but IMO the sacrifice is too great. I doubt anyone can have a Spot score so high that will detect you with Camouflage, Mass Camouflage and a Draconic DEX modifier. That's why I chose to keep him as is.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Come on MaX, bring back the original name, at least that was fun ;-0

Also, i believe it is "Camouflaged".

Now, you made a theme build but at least go all the way, i know you wanted an undispellable dragon but if he is to pretend being an Assassin then at least get a (Druid 20/ Assassin 18/ SD 2) split and go for both ESf's with Assassin's bonus feats.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
Come on MaX, bring back the original name, at least that was fun ;-0

Also, i believe it is "Camouflaged".

Now, you made a theme build but at least go all the way, i know you wanted an undispellable dragon but if he is to pretend being an Assassin then at least get a (Druid 20/ Assassin 18/ SD 2) split and go for both ESf's with Assassin's bonus feats.
I did some research and I found out it is indeed Camouflaged. I thought it was one of those cases with different spelling for American x British english (Color x Colour, Armor x Armour, Honor x Honour, etc..) where both were acceptable, but I was wrong. Thanks!

I brought back the original name and added the second one just because I can't save anything with astherisks on my computer, so I had to change it up.

For the concept, I like your suggestion, but I would rather list it as a viable tweak than actually add it to the build. The reason for this is that the character would gain the ESFs, but have a significantly higher chance of losing the Camouflage and Mass Camouflage buffs, which together account for 2 ESFs for each skill. Plus, dispellability for Druids is a really big problem, because they need to de-shift to rebuff, and this toon doesn't have infinite Elemental Shape, attained at Druid 26, and only 3 Dragon Shapes a day, which means he'd need to use the Dire Bear form for the mob-fights most of the time to make sure he has enough resources to last him. The Dire Bear form without Monk Wisdom AC is just AWFUL in defense. Shifting twice on the same battle is terrible for him. Still, at least until the first strike, your suggestion would be great and make him much harder to detect. But it'd also cause him to end up on an odd Wisdom score, but that's fixable dropping one GW for Armor Skin.

I'll edit the OP to include your suggestion.

Thanks!

Interesting take on the dragon here Max!
I just wonder if you can post the specs in dragon shape, to make it easier to compare with other builds?
Sure! Buffed numbers I presume

STR 60
DEX 41-44
CON 36
INT 15-18 (Fox's Cunning Wand)
WIS 46
CHA 8

AB= 55 (57 with Bless and Aid potions), 4 APR Hasted= 55/50/45/55 Attack Schedule. Not bad if you consider you'll be facing enemies who are flat-footed most of the time.

Damage: 2-16 +25 +7d6 Death Attack damage (19-20/x2).

DA DC is low, so only paralyzes on Auto-fail. Spell DCs are sufficiently high, though, enough to make them reliable for mob control, with 46 self-buffable Wisdom from Owl's Insight, which is indispellable. SoV will have a DC of 10 +9 + 18 = 37, which is not bad for melee low-dex types. Stonehold will have a DC of 34, which is enough for typical mobs that have around 15 Will at 40.

AC= 61 (62-63 with Cat's Grace potion) Hasted with a +5 armor, 50% Concealment from Assassin Improved Invisibility. Further increasable if you have access to DEX-boosting Armor or Shield before shifting and an Ioun Stone that boosts DEX. But you have HiPS for most battles so this low number is not really that important, except against true-seers.

Saves: 38 / 38 / 42 (Fort/Ref/Will)

Hide score: 82 (fully buffed)

Move Silently score: 62 (fully buffed)

With wands, these numbers could be better, but I didn't have the patience to make them or buy them in the trainer module.

You can cast Darkness, Invisibility, Ghostly Visage and Improved Invisibility from DS too, as they're Assassin feats, not spells. That's also pretty cool and useful.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It looks correct, 25 (BAB) +1 (EP) +25 (STR) +6 (CLAW) -2 (SIZ) = 55 AB

I believe the penalties to hide & move silently are (-8) to both of them, based on my PnP experience, but i might be wrong for NwN 1.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Your math is correct, Val, but there's a simpler way to do that in RL for lazy folks:

You AB is +4 whatever shows on the Character Sheet (+6 Claws - 2 Size)
Your AC is -2 whatever shows on the Character Sheet (-2 Size)

Presuming you know that WF/EWF Unarmed don't work while shifted and avoid taking them, of course!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, since Beamdog has changed the formula, one now needs 25 Caster levels to be safe from Dispelling.

So most builds now are subject to Dispelling (albeit low) due to this, and at 22, you are 3 levels under.

So there is that to consider.

Hey Astur!

Well, Druid 24 gives you a bonus feat, as well as making you indispellable, so removing 2 levels of Druid,  you don't just lose dispellability, you lose a feat. 

When optimizing builds, as per my general guide to building in the Game Guides section, you should always look at when each class gets what for the classes you're planning to use.

Druids gain 1 Bonus Feat every 4 levels after 20, so 24, 28, 32, 36 and 40. These would be the ideal places to stop leveling on Druid because that's where you get the most benefits.

Assassin, being a Prestige Class, grants a bonus feat every 4 levels after 10, so 14, 18, 22, 26 and 30 (can't have more than 30 Assassin levels in a build due to it being a Prestige Class)

Shadowdancer is also a Prestige Class, which grants HiPS with just 1 level, and Evasion at level 2. Darkvision is kind of nice, but the Dragon has True Seeing.

So, as you can see, in terms of optimization, this is as good as it gets. Val's split is also optimized, but he trades off the Druid feat and indispellability for a higher Death Attack DC and an Assassin Bonus feat. What is better is a matter of personal preference, whether you prefer to paralyze your opponents more often or have indispellable buffs, it's entirely up to you. I personally think that being dispelled hurts A LOT for Druids, because they can't rebuff while shifted, and de-shifting to rebuff is often more dangerous than it's worth. But as I said, it's my personal preference. 

Your suggested spread, however is not optimal. It doesn't end on a level that gives you anything in either Assassin or Druid, and for that reason, I'd suggest against it. This reminds me of when I started in the ECB, and I'd look at builds without really understanding why certain choices had been made by the builders, then I changed them, played them, they didn't reach their full potential, and then I went back to what the builder had originally come up with now knowing why he had chosen to do what he had done. That happened when I played Myth's Hierophant of Velsharoon and I JUST wanted to end on 20 Wisdom, but after playing it, I realized I wasn't really losing that much by ending at 19 Wisdom, and it allowed me to manage my inventory better, because I could just get +11 Wisdom enhancement to cap the modifier, so a +6 periapt and a +5 ring were enough to cap it. Anyway, I think what you can take from this is that sometimes you need to try to "get in the head" of the builder and imagine why he chose to do things the way he did. 

To be honest, I'd pick what you think is more valuable (indispellability or a higher DA DC), and just play the associated build.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Max, NWN EE has changed a bit.

There have been some changes, especially to Dispel - you now need 25 levels to be undispellable.  Also, Assassin Death Attack has been nerfed quite considerably (it only applying to the first attack, not flurry) AND Monk Stunning Fist is now only 1 round (meaning to be really good, one needs to do Stunning Fist/IKD for continuing "stay put and do nothing" tactics.

Also, Circle Kick was fixed (so one doesn't just stand there, flatfooted).

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Aug 18, 2020

There have been some changes, especially to Dispel - you now need 25 levels to be undispellable.  Also, Assassin Death Attack has been nerfed quite considerably (it only applying to the first attack, not flurry) AND Monk Stunning Fist is now only 1 round (meaning to be really good, one needs to do Stunning Fist/IKD for continuing "stay put and do nothing" tactics.

Also, Circle Kick was fixed (so one doesn't just stand there, flatfooted).
Hey WS!

Nice to know they're still working on this great game.  Unfortunately, myy machine is too old to run NwN EE. So, at least for me, this build still works as intended. Too bad about the nerf to Assassins. They should increase the DC, then, make it compatible with DevCrit DCs to even out this nerf. IMO Assassins weren't particularly OP as they were....

Anyway, thanks for the info. I guess it's worth noting then that this build is no longer good (not that it ever was LOL). This was a meme build based on how absurd it would be for anyone not to see or hear a Gargantuan Dragon approaching. It still cracks me up that things like these are possible in D&D LOL.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
A big, Gargantuan, silent and stealthy HIPSer Dragon!

Nothing like being tapped on the shoulder by a huuuuuge claw...
